headline: Shutdown’s End Will Kick Off Long Process of Rebooting US Government
summary: Delayed environmental permits, workplace inspections and contracting activities have stacked up across federal agencies.  None of the work of re-opening the government can officially launch until the funding bill has moved through Congress and has President Donald Trump’s signature.  Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said Wednesday that the administration aims to start lifting flight curbs within a week after the government reopens, a timeframe that comes just ahead of the busy Thanksgiving week travel holiday.

content.title: Shutdown’s End Will Kick Off Long Process of Rebooting US Government
content.summary: Delayed environmental permits, workplace inspections and contracting activities have stacked up across federal agencies.  None of the work of re-opening the government can officially launch until the funding bill has moved through Congress and has President Donald Trump’s signature.  Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said Wednesday that the administration aims to start lifting flight curbs within a week after the government reopens, a timeframe that comes just ahead of the busy Thanksgiving week travel holiday.

headline: U.S. Court of Appeals Grants Stay Requested by Aeroméxico and Delta

(“Aeroméxico”) (NYSE: AERO) announces that, on November 12, 2025, the United States Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit (“Eleventh Circuit”) granted the stay jointly requested by Aeroméxico and Delta Air Lines, Inc. (“Aeroméxico”) (NYSE: AERO) announces that, on November 12, 2025, the United States Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit (“Eleventh Circuit”) granted the stay jointly requested by Aeroméxico and Delta Air Lines, Inc. (“Delta”) relating to the final order, issued by the U.S. Department of Transportation (“DOT”) on September 15, 2025, terminating the antitrust immunity and withdrawing the approval it had previousl

headline: Record US Government Shutdown Ends as Trump Signs Spending Bill
summary: Trump’s signature means the government can begin to resume normal operations, with federal workers expected back on the job starting Thursday.  The Congressional Budget Office last month projected a six-week government closure would lower real gross domestic product growth in the current quarter by 1.5 percentage points.  A bit more than half of the loss may be recouped early next year as federal programs resume and government employees receive back pay, the CBO forecast.

content.title: Record US Government Shutdown Ends as Trump Signs Spending Bill
content.summary: Trump’s signature means the government can begin to resume normal operations, with federal workers expected back on the job starting Thursday.  The Congressional Budget Office last month projected a six-week government closure would lower real gross domestic product growth in the current quarter by 1.5 percentage points.  A bit more than half of the loss may be recouped early next year as federal programs resume and government employees receive back pay, the CBO forecast.

headline: Delta Recognized by Frost & Sullivan as "Company of the Year" for Integrated Energy Solutions in Europe
summary: Delta, a global leader in power management and smart green solutions, today announced it has been named the 2025 Company of the Year in the European Integrated Energy Solutions industry by Frost & Sullivan. This top honor recognizes Delta for its innovation capabilities, market-leading performance, and outstanding customer service, solidifying its position as a key enabler for Europe's energy transition.

content.title: Delta Recognized by Frost & Sullivan as "Company of the Year" for Integrated Energy Solutions in Europe
content.summary: Delta, a global leader in power management and smart green solutions, today announced it has been named the 2025 Company of the Year in the European Integrated Energy Solutions industry by Frost & Sullivan. This top honor recognizes Delta for its innovation capabilities, market-leading performance, and outstanding customer service, solidifying its position as a key enabler for Europe's energy transition.

thumbnail.caption: Delta Electronics receives Frost & Sullivan’s 2025 Award for European Integrated Energy Solutions Company of the Year.

headline: Government shutdown has been 'incredibly disruptive': Delta CEO
summary: Delta Air Lines (DAL) CEO, Ed Bastian, sits down with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi to explain how Delta and the greater airline industry have been impacted by the US federal government shutdown and what the road to recovery looks like going forward. For full interviews, highlights, and key insights, check out more from Yahoo Finance Invest.

headline: Is Swift Progress on Government Reopening Changing the Outlook for Delta Air Lines (DAL)?
summary: Delta Air Lines recently experienced widespread operational disruptions due to a U.S. government shutdown, but the carrier anticipates a swift recovery as the Senate passed a deal to reopen the government and resolve air traffic constraints. This renewed optimism is supported by CEO Ed Bastian expressing confidence in a strong fourth quarter and holiday season, alongside recognition of the airline’s resilience as it marks its 100th anniversary and embraces new technology for improved cargo...

This renewed optimism is supported by CEO Ed Bastian expressing confidence in a strong fourth quarter and holiday season, alongside recognition of the airline’s resilience as it marks its 100th anniversary and embraces new technology for improved cargo...
